docs.lead_paragraph: New Hampshire has one of the healthiest economies in the country, but voters are still deeply nervous about the nation’s fiscal health.

headline.main: In New Hampshire, Fiscal Anxiety Despite Relative Economic Health
headline.print_headline: In New Hampshire, Fiscal Anxiety Despite Relative Economic Health

docs.abstract: New Hampshire has one of the healthiest economies in the United States, but voters there are still deeply nervous about the nation's fiscal health; the high anxiety portends just how dominant the economy will be in the presidential campaign.
docs.snippet: New Hampshire has one of the healthiest economies in the country, but voters are still deeply nervous about the nation’s fiscal health.

byline.contributor: Jess Bidgood contributed reporting from Concord, N.H.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gambling everything, thousands of Haitians have made their way to small towns in the Brazilian Amazon over the past year in a desperate search for work.

headline.seo: Brazil’s Boom Absorbs Haiti’s Poor, For Now
headline.main: Haitians Take Arduous Path to Brazil, and Jobs
headline.print_headline: Haitians Take Arduous Path to Brazil, and Jobs

docs.abstract: Thousands of Haitians have made their way across the Americas to reach small towns in the Brazilian Amazon in a desperate search for work; latest surge of hundreds arrives amid fears that Brazilian government could slow influx; their improbable journey says as much about the dire economic conditions that persist in Haiti as it does about the rising economic profile of Brazil
docs.snippet: Gambling everything, thousands of Haitians have made their way to small towns in the Brazilian Amazon over the past year in a desperate search for work.

byline.contributor: Lis Horta Moriconi and Erika O’Conor contributed reporting from Rio de Janeiro.

docs.lead_paragraph: Help was provided for a Staten Island man who had been struggling to keep his house when he was told he had a serious health problem.

headline.seo: For Father Working Three Jobs, a Startling Diagnosis
headline.main: For Father Working Three Jobs, a Startling Diagnosis
headline.print_headline: Working Three Jobs to Try to Dig Out of Debt, and Encountering a Startling Diagnosis

docs.abstract: Community Service Society of New York helps Jose Perez of Staten Island, who has renal failure, get support he needs to feed his family and pay his bills.
docs.snippet: Help was provided for a Staten Island man who had been struggling to keep his house when he was told he had a serious health problem.

keywords.value: New York Times Neediest Cases Fund
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Many older unemployed people — nearly two million over age 55 — must make tough decisions about how to make up for lost income.

headline.main: Laid Off, With Retirement Almost in Sight
headline.print_headline: Laid Off, With Retirement Almost in Sight

docs.abstract: Your Money column observes that many older unemployed people—nearly two million over age 55—must make tough decisions about how to make up for lost income; discusses several little-known tricks that can help create a financial bridge of sorts until one can either find work or manage to eke their way to retirement.
docs.snippet: Many older unemployed people — nearly two million over age 55 — must make tough decisions about how to make up for lost income.

docs.abstract: One readers asks why more business owners don't support single-payer health insurance.
docs.snippet: One readers asks why more business owners don't support single-payer health insurance.

docs.abstract: One readers asks why more business owners don't support single-payer health insurance.

headline.main: What Price Pluralism in Health Insurance?

docs.abstract: The lack of uniformity and the variety of options in American health-insurance plans adds significantly to costs, an economist writes.
docs.snippet: The lack of uniformity and the variety of options in American health-insurance plans adds significantly to costs, an economist writes.

docs.lead_paragraph: A ruling by the state’s highest court said that a 2009 budget that dropped about 29,000 legal immigrants from Commonwealth Care violated the state Constitution.

headline.main: Massachusetts Health Plan Extended to Immigrants
headline.print_headline: Massachusetts Health Plan Extended to Immigrants

docs.abstract: Massachusetts highest court rules that state cannot bar legal immigrants from a state health care program; decision edges Massachusetts closer to its goal of providing near-universal health care coverage to its residents.
docs.snippet: A ruling by the state’s highest court said that a 2009 budget that dropped about 29,000 legal immigrants from Commonwealth Care violated the state Constitution.

docs.lead_paragraph: The president of the clinic responds to an Op-Ed article, “It Costs More, but Is It Worth It?”
docs.snippet: The president of the clinic responds to an Op-Ed article, “It Costs More, but Is It Worth It?”

headline.main: The Shame of Filling a Prescription

docs.abstract: Most physicians think little about prescriptions after they hand them off to their patients. But patients can face shame and humiliation when filling a prescription.
docs.snippet: Most physicians think little about prescriptions after they hand them off to their patients. But patients can face shame and humiliation when filling a prescription.
